result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Modesto Guzman-Trujillo

records.addlTxt: State's Motion to Admit Forensic Interview in the Interests of Justice - Guzman-Trujillo, Modesto.pdf, Filed.

Defendant Modesto Guzman-Trujillo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court for Modesto Guzman-Trujillo.  Assistant District Attorney Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel waived the Spanish Interpreter for this matter.  
Bail bond hearing proceeded.   Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court GRANTED defense bail motion.  The Court modified bail from $25,000. cash to $10,000. cash along  with the following conditions: 
Defendant turned over to Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Defendant to remain in custody until Monitoring Bracelet is available.   Court ordered absolute sobriety, random urine screens, and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant to have NO CONTACT with Maria M., her children and/or their place of residence.  
Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn

Defendant Modesto Guzman-Trujillo not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court for Modesto Guzman-Trujillo.  Assistant District Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  Parties in court for scheduling.  The defense is requesting a final pre trial and jury trial.  The Court advised parties that all pre trial documents are to be forwarded to the court 48hrs. prior to final pre trial.  Any motions must be filed by 11/4, with reply or response due 11/23/22.  State is requesting a date for motion hearing. 
 Defense is also requesting a bail motion in this matter.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Motion hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
CORRESPONDENCE RE MOTION FOR BOND MODIFICATION, Filed.

Defendant Modesto Guzman-Trujillo not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court for Modesto Guzman-Trujillo.  Prosecuting attorney Alicia H Kort in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for an additional scheduling in Br 45.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sworn as Spanish interpreter: Natalia Fajardo

Defendant Modesto Guzman-Trujillo appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening appeared by video for Modesto Guzman-Trujillo.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Klauser. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Modesto Guzman-Trujillo not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening appeared by video for Modesto Guzman-Trujillo.   Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
The matter was previously scheduled incorrectly. Matter originally in court for Preliminary hearing. Court ordered case adjourned CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Modesto Guzman-Trujillo in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Modesto Guzman-Trujillo in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court by video, defendant Modesto Guzman-Trujillo not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense requests an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 064734,
Payable Number: 1019071,
Receipt Number: 22RP027979,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Modesto Guzman-Trujillo not in court, defendant in custody.  Alicia Kort appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring - No Contact Monitoring Only.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Maria M., her residence or her children.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Modesto Guzman-Trujillo in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Modesto Guzman-Trujillo in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.    DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
